I believe that we need more racism so that there is more racial harmony

The issue about racial harmony in SG right now from my perspective  is that everyone is damn scared of being offensive towards another race. The issue with this is that the reason why someone is offensive unintentionally is normally due to their preconceived mental schema towards these races. If we continue to "cancel" and refuse to have constructive dialogue about what racism is and how it looks like  effectively it becomes very difficult to create a racially harmonious society
People need to be more openly racist for this kind of dialogue to even thrive

this also stems from the fact that Singaporeans and Singapore's policy making is not really about constructing racial harmony but racial blindness. So if you wanna be like really technical abt it  it is very hard to envision how racial harmony in SG actually looks like cause no one even knows how to start
TLDR The problem with racism in SG rn is that it threatens a shift from equality in opportunity to an equity in outcome
